intro: Comesperma variabile, commonly known as the variable comesperma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia, where it typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in open woodlands and can tolerate a range of environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
